definition: unceasing torrent (idiom)/talking non-stop/gabbling forty to the dozen
overflow/torrent-dash
overflow/torrent-dash
(negative prefix)/not/no
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
variant of 絕|绝[jue2]

sentences.english: He completely monopolized the conversation last night; Mary and I couldn't get a word in edgeways.
sentences.chinese: 他昨晚滔滔不绝地讲话，玛丽和我完全插不上嘴。

sentences.english: People gushing on and on about their amazing love life?
sentences.chinese: 有人滔滔不绝地讲述她们那让人惊叹的爱情生活？

sentences.english: The whale only gets harpooned when he spouts.
sentences.chinese: 只有得到的鲸鱼时，他滔滔不绝地镖。

sentences.english: Every words poured out it echoes of your love.
sentences.chinese: 每次滔滔不绝的字都有你爱的回音。

sentences.english: She talks so much that the rest of us never get a look-in .
sentences.chinese: 他讲得滔滔不绝，别人都无法插嘴。

sentences.english: While the master quietly served tea, the professor talked about Zen.
sentences.chinese: 当禅师安静地准备茶水时，学者滔滔不绝地谈着禅。

sentences.english: Charles is such a gasser when he gets going about himself.
sentences.chinese: 查尔斯一谈到自己，就劲头十足，滔滔不绝。

sentences.english: The hired orators continued to pour forth their streams of eloquence.
sentences.chinese: 那些雇来的演说家继续滔滔不绝地施展辩才。

sentences.english: Uncle Wang ran on, airing his views about the cases.
sentences.chinese: 王大爷滔滔不绝地谈着，发表对这案件的看法。

sentences.english: He tried to Buy time by doing a lot of talking.
sentences.chinese: 他为了争取时间滔滔不绝地讲个没完。

sentences.english: Because who needs to hear people cursing like Tourette's patients on speed and failing to work together?
sentences.chinese: 有谁愿意听他们滔滔不绝的骂人并导致团队解散吗？

sentences.english: They are off and running with their description of their own experience.
sentences.chinese: 他们滔滔不绝地说着自己的经历。

sentences.english: Mr. Blankfein talks about himself humorously and well.
sentences.chinese: 布兰克芬谈到自己时滔滔不绝，且言辞诙谐。

sentences.english: She talked at us about her family life.
sentences.chinese: 她对我们滔滔不绝地讲她的家庭生活。

sentences.english: He gave me an earful of complaints about his new boss.
sentences.chinese: 他滔滔不绝向我抱怨他的新老板。

sentences.english: He talked as volubly as ever.
sentences.chinese: 他还像从前一样滔滔不绝地说着话。

definition: mouth like a torrent (idiom)/eloquent/glib/voluble/have the gift of the gab
smiles of exultation/radiant with delight
to speak frankly with assurance
to chatter or jabber on and on
vivid and colorful (idiom); true to life/lively and realistic
long-winded/garrulous/to talk endlessly without getting to the point
to start talking
lit. as if enumerating one's family valuables (idiom)/fig. to be very familiar with a matter
lit. to quote the classics/to quote chapter and verse (idiom)
to talk about this and that (idiom); to ramble incoherently
to chatter/to babble
to harangue/loud arrogant talk/to spout
hands dance and feet trip (idiom); dancing and gesticulating for joy
barrage of gunfire (often used as a metaphor for rapid speech)
to talk big/to sound off/bombastic/grandiloquent
impassioned/vehement
